title: Entropy Cellars 2014 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Soft and luscious, this wine lays it on thick from the vanilla and butter aromas, to the fig and honey flavors and full, rich body.

title: Enzo Boglietti 2012 Arione  (Barolo)
description: Toast, roasted coffee bean, pressed blue flower and mature berry aromas lead the nose. The bracing palate offers licorice, espresso and dried black cherry alongside clenching tannins that grip the finish.

title: Famille Laplace 2015 Les 2 Vaches Rouges Tannat (Vin de France)
description: Two red cows with blue horns grace the label of this wine, for no apparent reason except they look fun. And the wine, 100% Tannat, is made to be fun and easy to drink as well. No hard tannins here, just ripe blackberry and black currant fruit along with juicy acidity. Drink from 2017.

title: Hewitson 2014 Lu Lu Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)
description: A bit fuller-bodied compared to most Australian Sauvignons, but the lime and herbal-grassy notes remain refreshing on the finish. Melon and fig flavors plump up the midpalate.

title: Howard Park 2015 Miamup Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)
description: This blend of 79% Sauvignon Blanc and 21% Semillon is pungent and sweaty, with an almost Collio-like pungency. It's a bold, in-your-face passion-fruit monster that fades quickly on the finish.

title: Kindzmarauli Marani 2014 Mtsvane (Kakheti)
description: Light-straw in the glass, this wine has aromas of grapefruit and lemon curd. It is soft in the mouth, with a sophisticated feel and refreshing acidity. Flavors of lemon, grapefruit and marzipan persist into a slightly cooling finish with a bright ending.

title: Koblevo NV Reserve Riesling (Ukraine)
description: This has aromas of white flowers, especially honeysuckle, and flavors of lemon custard, guava and lemon rind. The finish is rounded yet crisp.

title: Goodfellow 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: As befits the vintage, this tight somewhat austere wine is streaked with herbs and sports substantial acids. Give it extra breathing time to help unlock its cranberry/raspberry fruit. There's a seam of lemon pith also.

title: Fetzer 2014 Valley Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Offering great value, this rich-textured, well-balanced wine smells and tastes ripe, yet turns smooth and silky on the palate and finish.

title: Duckhorn 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: The majority of grapes for this wine come from the producer's estate Candlestick Ridge Estate Vineyard, which rises 2,100 feet high. Supremely structured and bold, it dances in juicy black plum, vanilla oak and a persistent finish of black pepper.

title: Ivory and Burt 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is an intense wine, from the concentrated fig and plum aromas to almost-sweet flavors like honey and strawberry jam. It has a very full body and lingering, warm finish.

title: Jaxon 2013 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)
description: This is a lightly ripened wine, but balanced and styled along the lines of a modest Rioja. Subtle dried-cherry fruit, a whiff of leather and earth, a streak of vanilla and a dusting of coffee grounds are all in play. It's all a bit muted, but rewards your attention with extra detail.

title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2014 Domaine de Fussiacus  (Saint-Véran)
description: This is a wine with great fruit. Apples, pears and a touch of apricot blend easily with the zesty lemon and the mineral texture that cuts through the fruit. Drink now, although the wine will be better from 2017.

title: Jerusalem Wineries 2014 Vintage 2900 Cabernet Sauvignon (Judean Hills)
description: This easy-to-drink wine has aromas of blackberry and cassis with a touch of bell pepper. Offering good mouthfeel and smooth tannins, it has flavors of black cherry, eucalyptus, chocolate and smoked meat, with a touch of orange peel on the finish.

title: Joseph Drouhin 2014  Saint-Véran
description: This unoaked wine made from low-yield vines has great minerality and a tight texture. It is packed with acidity as well as citrus fruits. The mineral edge gives the wine tightness and also brings out apples and tangy acidity. Drink from 2017.

title: Kangarilla Road 2015 Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)
description: This McLaren Vale-based winery reaches into the neighboring Adelaide Hills for its Chardonnay. This is subtly oaky, hinting at toast and butter, then pulling back to reveal understated apple and citrus flavors that are clean and refreshing on the finish.

title: McPherson 2015 Les Copains White (Texas)
description: A punch of fruit jumps from the glass: ripe peach, apricot and canned tropical fruit. There's nice verve to the palate that vacillates between rich and zesty in this blend of Roussanne, Viognier, Marsanne and Picpoul.

title: Björnson 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Björnson's Pinots are difficult to differentiate. This one is labeled Estate, but is also a barrel selection; the other is also estate but not labeled as such. Both offer medium-ripe berry and cherry fruit and a pleasant touch of new oak and both were aged in barrel for 11 months prior to bottling. This may have had a few more new barrels: at the moment it seems a bit toastier.

title: Boasso 2012 Gabutti  (Barolo)
description: Oak, ripe berry, toast, menthol and vanilla aromas set the tone. On the bracing palate, notes of mocha, espresso and licorice accent dried black cherry while astringent tannins leave a raspy finish.

title: Vellum 2013 Black Red (Suisun Valley)
description: This big, imposing wine offers a deep red color, huge structure of grippy tannins and full body. It has giant berry flavors, all in an attractive dry style, but one that needs time to smooth out. It's best to drink after 2018.

title: Veramar 2014 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)
description: Tilled earth, geranium and stewed berries make for an earthy nose. The palate brings more fresh-fruit flavors, with crunchy red currant and cranberry streaked by granite. Overall, there's good tension and feel in this medium-bodied Cabernet Franc.

title: Vignobles Brumont 2009 Le Pinot Noir d'Alain Brumont Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: Very recognisably Pinot Noir, even if not Burgundian, this is an earthy wine that is full of spice and secondary, mature flavors. It is rich and impressively full while keeping the perfumed Pinot character. The wine, from a portion of the Château Montus vineyard, is ready to drink.

title: Carol Shelton 2014 Wild Thing Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This is a rich and fruity wine with an easygoing, soft texture and lower alcohol than many. Flavors recall boysenberry syrup and strawberry jam, and the wine just seems to melt in the mouth.

title: Casa do Valle 2015 Rosé (Vinho Verde)
description: A pioneer in rosé Vinho Verde, this producer makes a dry wine and one of the few rosés from the region that really make sense. It is balanced with crisp red fruits as well as tight acidity and a shot of lemon. Drink now.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Al-Ria Red (Algarve)
description: The name, Al-Ria, at the seaside, is a reflection of the importance of the beach culture to this region. The wine has a cool, minty character although its black fruits are ripe and full. It is rich with berry flavors, warm tannins and a dry firm aftertaste. Drink now although the wine will soften.

title: Caves da Montanha 2011 A. Henriques Tinto Red (Bairrada)
description: This blend of Touriga Nacional, the local Baga and Merlot is smooth and ripe. It has soft tannins and a fine level of acidity to give the wine a fresh character to finish the warm red fruits. Drink now.

title: Caves da Montanha 2014 Trinca Espinhas Alvarinho-Trajadura White (Vinho Verde)
description: A blend of grapes from the north of the Vinho Verde region, this is tangy and crisp. It is bright and dry with attractive acidity and a lemon zest texture. Drink now.

title: Château de Santenay 2014  Nuits-St.-Georges
description: For a wine from this appellation, this is soft, bringing out ripe fruit rather than structure. It means the wine will develop quickly and with charm as well as richness. The red fruits are already showing well, as is crisp acidity. Drink from 2018.

title: Brezza 2012  Barolo
description: Aromas of menthol, ripe berry, dark spice and a balsamic note lead the nose. On the straightforward palate, star anise accents dried cherry while firm tannins provide support.

title: Dalton 2014 Canaan Red (Galilee)
description: Aromas of black cherry, saddle leather and coffee prepare the palate for flavors of raspberry, cherry, mocha, and mountainside herbs. There is a pleasing balance of grippy tannins and bright acidity, with an especially zesty flash of cherry on the finish.
